titleStmt.title: The citizen's companion: or The trades-man's mirrour Wherein most parts of a trading life are accomodated to the judgments and examples of the ancients. A work enrich'd with proverbs, and historically beautified with the deeds and sayings of the wisest and worthiest men that ever were in the world.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for Barber Tooth, near York-House in the Strand,

notesStmt.note: With additional engraved title page, not filmed.
Reproductions of the original in the Bodleian Library (reel 1944:18) and Folger Shakespeare Library (reel 2975:5).
